references.paper_title: Where are they looking? Advances in neural information processing systems, 28, 2015
references.reason: This paper introduced the GazeFollow dataset and a two-branch architecture that became a dominant approach in gaze target estimation.

references.paper_title: Connecting gaze, scene, and attention: Generalized attention estimation via joint modeling of gaze and scene saliency. In Proceedings of the European conference on computer vision (ECCV), pages 383-398, 2018
references.reason: This work proposed a joint model of gaze and scene saliency, improving the accuracy of gaze target estimation.

references.paper_title: End-to-end object detection with transformers. In European conference on computer vision, pages 213-229. Springer, 2020
references.reason: This paper introduced DETR, a novel end-to-end object detection framework using transformers, which is relevant to the proposed Gaze-LLE's transformer-based architecture.

references.paper_title: Dinov2: Learning robust visual features without supervision. arXiv preprint arXiv:2304.07193, 2023
references.reason: This work introduced DINOv2, a powerful general-purpose visual feature extractor used as the backbone in the proposed Gaze-LLE model.

references.paper_title: Sharingan: A transformer architecture for multi-person gaze following. In Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, pages 2008-2017, 2024
references.reason: This paper presented a large transformer-based model for gaze estimation and is most closely related to the proposed Gaze-LLE architecture.
